subject: Personal Finance
title: Tariffs and Trade Wars
description: A short lesson to help you apply Tariffs and Trade Wars.

hook.text: A 25% tariff on foreign steel sounds like it helps domestic steel workers. But it raises prices for everyone.

buildup.text: Tariffs are taxes on imported goods. They protect domestic industries but increase costs for consumers.

discovery.text: When one country imposes tariffs, trading partners retaliate. A trade war makes everything more expensive.

twist.text: The US-China trade war raised prices for American consumers by an estimated $800 per household.

climax.text: Tariffs protect some jobs but destroy others. The car industry may benefit while car buyers suffer.

punchline.text: Tariffs protect a few, cost everyone else.

quiz.question: Who ultimately pays for tariffs on imported goods?
